Why this matters Let’s start with this greeting assumes male is the default gender. It says to women and trans people that they are second to men and not important enough to include in a greeting. It perpetuates the patriarchy and is also transphobic. Imagine saying “hey guys” to a group that included a trans woman, that would be a micro-aggression.

So much of our language centers on gender, which is assumed to be cisgender. Why does gender need to be a part of a greeting? Why does gender need to be included in statements that it is not related to: when we say “you’re such a good boy/girl” what does gender have to do with it? Why not “that was a great job”. Let it be actions and behaviors we talk about without bringing gender into it. But I digress…

Ways to greet a group of people

Hey Y’all or You all People not from the southern states in the US have my full permission to get over their issue with this. This is the best gender inclusive greeting that rolls off the tongue. Our language should evolve, and yankees saying y’all should be normalized.

Hey Folks/Folx Side note: Folx is a variation of the word folks that is meant to be a gender neutral way to refer to members of the LGBTQIA+ community. It comes from Lantinx with is a gender neutral way to say Latino or Latina.

One more thing; replacing other gendered phrasing

If you use the following phrases, note how they are very gendered.

  • hey girl
  • you go, girl
  • you’re my boy
  • that’s my boy
  • my girls/ my boys

Instead, you can say

  • hey person/human/friend/mate
  • you go human/friend/mate
  • you’re my person/human/friend/mate
  • that’s my person/human/friend/mate
  • my persons, humans, friends, mates
